title: Design-Based Problem-Solving Education Innovation in Architecture and Planning Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Application of design-based problem-solving approaches to adapt to post-pandemic educational environments

learning_goals: Learners analyze real-world problems in architecture and planning using design-based approaches and propose solutions.
Learners strengthen instructional design competencies by applying the three elements of the DIA (Delivery-Interaction-Assessment) framework.
Through project-based assessments, learners draft spatial plans to address community issues.

resources: LMS Platform (Video Lectures, Discussion Forums, Resource Repository)
Case Analysis Library for Architecture/Urban Planning Materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
